datasetStructure: One record per planned Element per Arm

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.ARMCD

datasetVariables.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than that for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven-period crossover were constructed using two-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.ARM

datasetVariables.description: Name given to an Arm or treatment group.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

modelDatasetVariable.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.TAETORD

self.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

datasetVariables.description: Number that gives the order of the Element within the Arm.

datasetVariables.name: TAETORD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.ETCD

datasetVariables.description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.
datasetVariables.label: Element Code
datasetVariables.name: ETCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.ELEMENT

datasetVariables.description: The name of the Element. The same Element may occur more than once within an Arm.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Element
datasetVariables.name: ELEMENT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.TABRANCH

datasetVariables.description: Condition subject met, at a "branch" in the trial design at the end of this Element, to be included in this Arm (e.g., "Randomization to DRUG X").
datasetVariables.label: Branch
datasetVariables.name: TABRANCH

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.TATRANS

datasetVariables.description: If the trial design allows a subject to transition to an Element other than the next Element in sequence, then the conditions for transitioning to those other Elements, and the alternative Element sequences, are specified in this rule (e.g., "Responders go to washout").
datasetVariables.label: Transition Rule
datasetVariables.name: TATRANS

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99079

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TA.EPOCH

datasetVariables.description: Name of the Trial Epoch with which this Element of the Arm is associated.
datasetVariables.label: Epoch
datasetVariables.name: EPOCH

description: A trial design domain that contains each planned arm in the trial. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49618, 2018-06-29)
label: Trial Arms
name: TA
